div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 9px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4; color: #333;

foreignObject.div: This proposal outlines a comprehensive grazing and burning management plan for the Chancellor and Koshland pastures at UC Berkeley. The plan focuses on using domestic livestock grazing to reduce invasive woody species and controlled burnings to lower fire risk.

div.style: font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 9px; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.4; color: #333;

foreignObject.div: The Chancellor and Koshland pastures are valuable ecological resources that require active management to maintain their biodiversity and reduce fire hazards. This management plan proposes a combination of targeted grazing and prescribed burning to achieve these goals.

svg.text: Figure 1: Map of Chancellor and Koshland pastures management zones
